philosophy_map.name: Philosophy Map
philosophy_map.description: A comprehensive map of philosophical disciplines, methods, and traditions

logic_and_philosophical_methods.name: Logic and Philosophical Methods
logic_and_philosophical_methods.description: The methods with which philosophy connects various disciplines and translates normal language into evaluable forms

extra.propositional_logic: Macro logic dealing with relations between propositions and statements
extra.categorical_logic: Older version of logic working on micro scale with subjects and predicates
extra.predicate_calculus: Modern combination that quantifies over subjects and predicates

higher_order_logic.name: Higher Order Logic
higher_order_logic.description: Quantifies over predicates as well as objects

modal_logic.name: Modal Logic
modal_logic.description: Logic that quantifies over logical modality

extra.description: Relates to truth; includes necessity, possibility, and impossibility
Relates to obligation, permissibility, and prohibition
Relates to time; includes pastness, presentness, and futurity
Relates to knowledge; includes probability and certainty

informal_logic_critical_thinking.name: Informal Logic Critical Thinking
informal_logic_critical_thinking.description: Methods including rhetoric, dialectic, and critical analysis; often precedes formal logic in argument construction

philosophical_methods.name: Philosophical Methods
philosophical_methods.description: Various strategies for approaching philosophical questions

metaphysics.name: Metaphysics
metaphysics.description: The study of the fundamental nature of reality, including questions about existence, identity, time, and causation

metaphysical_themes.name: Metaphysical Themes
metaphysical_themes.description: Core topics and debates within metaphysics

ontology_and_what_exists.name: Ontology and What Exists
ontology_and_what_exists.description: Categories of being and what kinds of things exist

universals_and_particulars.name: Universals and Particulars
universals_and_particulars.description: Debate over whether properties (universals) exist independently of particulars

properties_and_tropes.name: Properties and Tropes
properties_and_tropes.description: Nature of properties and whether they are repeatable universals or particularized tropes

substance_and_essence.name: Substance and Essence
substance_and_essence.description: What makes an object the kind of thing it is (its essential features)

existence_and_identity.name: Existence and Identity
existence_and_identity.description: Criteria for existence and the identity conditions for objects

time_and_modality.name: Time and Modality
time_and_modality.description: The nature of time and possibility/necessity

a_theory_b_theory.name: A Theory B Theory
a_theory_b_theory.description: Debates between dynamic (A-theory) and static (B-theory) views of time

possible_worlds.name: Possible Worlds
possible_worlds.description: Frameworks for understanding modality via possible worlds semantics

counterfactuals.name: Counterfactuals
counterfactuals.description: Conditionals about what would be the case under different circumstances

causation_and_laws.name: Causation and Laws
causation_and_laws.description: Nature of causality, laws of nature, and related metaphysical issues

regularity_vs_necessitation.name: Regularity vs Necessitation
regularity_vs_necessitation.description: Are laws summaries of regularities or do they necessitate events?

agency_and_causation.name: Agency and Causation
agency_and_causation.description: How agents cause actions and events

identity_and_change.name: Identity and Change
identity_and_change.description: How objects persist and change over time

persistance_and_endurantism_perdurantism.name: Persistance and Endurantism Perdurantism
persistance_and_endurantism_perdurantism.description: Debates over whether objects persist by enduring wholly or perduring as temporal parts

ship_of_theseus.name: Ship of Theseus
ship_of_theseus.description: Classical puzzle about identity through replacement of parts

epistemology.name: Epistemology
epistemology.description: The study of knowledge, belief, justification, and rationality

sources_of_knowledge.name: Sources of Knowledge
sources_of_knowledge.description: Where knowledge comes from and how it is justified

a_priori_and_a_posteriori.name: A Priori and A Posteriori
a_priori_and_a_posteriori.description: Knowledge independent of experience versus knowledge from experience

perception_memory_testimony_reason.name: Perception Memory Testimony Reason
perception_memory_testimony_reason.description: Key sources and routes to knowledge

structure_of_justification.name: Structure of Justification
structure_of_justification.description: Competing theories of how beliefs are justified

foundationalism.name: Foundationalism
foundationalism.description: Beliefs are justified by basic beliefs

coherentism.name: Coherentism
coherentism.description: Justification arises from coherence among beliefs

infinitism.name: Infinitism
infinitism.description: Justification consists of infinite non-repeating reasons

reliabilism.name: Reliabilism
reliabilism.description: Beliefs are justified by being produced by reliable processes

skepticism_and_contextualism.name: Skepticism and Contextualism
skepticism_and_contextualism.description: Limits of knowledge and the role of context in truth-conditions

radical_skepticism.name: Radical Skepticism
radical_skepticism.description: Arguments suggesting knowledge might be impossible

contextualism.name: Contextualism
contextualism.description: Knowledge ascriptions vary with conversational context

value_theory.name: Value Theory
value_theory.description: Philosophical investigation into what is valuable, including ethics, politics, and aesthetics

ethics.name: Ethics
ethics.description: The study of morality and how we ought to live

meta_ethics.name: Meta Ethics
meta_ethics.description: Questions about the nature of moral facts, properties, and language

normative_ethics.name: Normative Ethics
normative_ethics.description: Theories about what makes actions right or wrong

deontology.name: Deontology
deontology.description: Rightness depends on duties, rules, or rights

virtue_ethics.name: Virtue Ethics
virtue_ethics.description: Focus on character and virtues (Aristotelian tradition)

applied_ethics.name: Applied Ethics
applied_ethics.description: Application of ethical theory to practical domains

aesthetics.name: Aesthetics
aesthetics.description: Study of beauty, art, and aesthetic experience

political_philosophy.name: Political Philosophy
political_philosophy.description: Study of the state, justice, rights, liberty, and political obligations

social_philosophy.name: Social Philosophy
social_philosophy.description: Study of social values, structures, and collective life

bridging_disciplines.name: Bridging Disciplines
bridging_disciplines.description: Philosophy as it connects with and informs other disciplines

philosophy_of_science.name: Philosophy of Science
philosophy_of_science.description: Study of methods, aims, and structure of scientific inquiry

scientific_methodology.name: Scientific Methodology
scientific_methodology.description: Underdetermination, Problem of Induction, and the New Riddle of Induction

philosophy_of_language.name: Philosophy of Language
philosophy_of_language.description: Meaning, reference, truth, and linguistic structure

expressions.name: Expressions
expressions.description: Indexicals, demonstratives, predicates, quantifiers, conditionals, temporal expressions

philosophy_of_mind.name: Philosophy of Mind
philosophy_of_mind.description: Consciousness, mental states, and the mind-body relation

consciousness.name: Consciousness
consciousness.description: Philosophical questions about what makes something conscious; possibility of philosophical zombies; machine consciousness

mental_states.name: Mental States
mental_states.description: Belief and emotions (anger, fear, love, disgust, happiness)

mind_body_interaction.name: Mind Body Interaction
mind_body_interaction.description: How mental and physical states interact

decision_theory.name: Decision Theory
decision_theory.description: Rational choice, game theory, and decision paradoxes

free_will.name: Free Will
free_will.description: Compatibilism, libertarianism, and determinism; key questions about the existence and nature of free will

philosophy_of_religion.name: Philosophy of Religion
philosophy_of_religion.description: Arguments about the existence and nature of God, religious experience, and attributes of divinity

arguments_against_god.name: Arguments Against God
arguments_against_god.description: Problem of evil and the Euthyphro dilemma
